Support

MatrixLib has been extensively tested, and is in use with many calculation-intensive engineering applications. However, if you feel that you have found a bug, we want to hear from you. In order to provide effective technical support, we need detailed information from you about the nature of your problem. This information includes:

  • The date of and name under which purchase was made.
  • The version of MatrixLib you are using - check the top of the header "matrix.h" for ML_VERSION_STRING.
  • The operating system you are using.
  • What kind of hardware you are using.
  • Whether or not you are using LAPACK/BLAS.
  • Are you using a binary installation of MatrixLib or working with the source?

Then describe your "bug". Make sure you tell us:

  • Is this a compile error, a run-time error (crash), or a data error (incorrect calculation)
  • Can you regularly reproduce the error?
  • Provide the source code (or a useful subset) that causes the error.

Send all of this information via email to support@psatellite.com. One of our software engineers will respond to confirm reciept of your email, and then investigate the problem. We will request additional information if necessary, and provide you with either:

  • A work-around that achieves the desired result without causing the error.
  • An updated binary (or source code distribution as appropriate) if the error is in MatrixLib and no work-around is possible.
  • Assistance identifying the reason for the error if it is in your own code.
